message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.CC, cs.CG. 

The paper deals with the list-decodability of linear codes, which is a topic in information theory (cs.IT). The main technical ingredient involves analyzing the linear span of random vectors in a Hamming ball, which is a problem in discrete mathematics (cs.DM) and combinatorics (cs.CC). The paper also uses probabilistic arguments and random constructions, which are common in algorithms and data structures (cs.DS). Finally, the paper may be of interest to researchers in computational geometry (cs.CG) due to its use of geometric concepts such as Hamming balls.
